content: top down new-born jacket by donna wilby materials double knit yarn dk about 100g 4mm hook 5 12-15mm buttons of your choice us terms chain chain st stitch double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch fo fasten_off special stitches increase increase 3 stitches in same stitch unless otherwise stated fpdc front post double_crochet bpdc back post double_crochet gauge 10hdc x 7 row = 2 square please trust the pattern and follow it to the stitch especially the front edge you must count every stitch and only put 32 stitches up the front or it will come out wonky all increases are 3 stitches not the usual 2 special notes on the body every row starts with a ch1 this does not count as a stitch so your half_double_crochet should be in the same stitch as the ch1 on the arms every row starts as a ch2 this ch2 counts as the first stitch when doing the button band and neck edging it may look like it s not enough stitches but once pulled into shape it does work perfectly so trust it even if it seems to be too tight ch46 row 1 half_double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook and in next 7 inc3 in next st half_double_crochet in next 5 inc3 in next st half_double_crochet in next 14 inc3 in next st half_double_crochet in next 5 inc3 in next st half_double_crochet in next 8 place a marker in the centre stitch of each increase stitch and move marker each row row 2 10 ch1 turn half_double_crochet in each stitch placing an increase3 in the centre increase from the previous row and moving the markers up as you come to them it should measure 8 25 inches across the front at this point with 124 stitches row 11 ch1 turn half_double_crochet in each stitch to the first marker 1 half_double_crochet here then skip all stitches to the 2nd marker place 1 half_double_crochet here half_double_crochet to the next marker place 1 half_double_crochet in the marked stitch then skip all stitches to the next marker 1 half_double_crochet here and in each stitch to the end armholes made 74 row 12- 27 ch1 turn half_double_crochet in first stitch and each stitch to the end 74 rib row row 28 ch2 fpdc around next stitch bpdc around next stitch repeat to last stitch half_double_crochet in the last stitch row 29 ch2 bpdc around next stitch fpdc around next stitch repeat to last stitch half_double_crochet in the last stitch row 30 repeat row 28 do not fasten_off continue to button and neck band unless using a different colour for the band in which case join yarn in last st and ch1 button and neck band row 1 ch1 working up the front edge fit 6 half_double_crochet into the ends of the rib row then half_double_crochet in the end of each row up the front 32 hdcs count your stitches it s very important you have the same amount of stitches each side inc3 in
